main event: A round object was observed in the sky by a ground observer in Alger, Michigan on February 9, 1956.
interesting points: The object was the size of a volleyball held at arm's length., The color of the object changed from red to pink and back to bright red., The object made no sound and left no tail or exhaust., The observer noted an elevation of 80 degrees and an azimuth of 270 degrees at initial observation., The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes before the object dropped over the horizon.
